text.section:
In this section, "federal act" means:
The federal Self-Employed Individuals Tax Retirement Act of 1962; or
The federal Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
A savings bank may act as trustee of a plan under either federal act, as provided in this section.

A savings bank may:
Accept a trust under a plan that:
Constitutes a qualified plan under a federal act and the rules and regulations adopted under it; and
Requires the exclusive investment of trust funds in deposits of a mutual savings institution; and
Continue as trustee of a plan that is determined not to be or ceases to be a qualified plan, if, when the savings bank accepted the trust, the savings bank judged the plan to be a qualified plan.

A savings bank that is acting as trustee of a plan under a federal act:
May integrate the trust funds with its other deposits; and
Shall keep appropriate, detailed records of all transactions in which it engages as trustee.
